alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 28 at 2:17PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF WEST CENTRAL SOCORRO AND NORTHEASTERN CATRON COUNTIES THROUGH 245 PM MDT... At 216 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Datil, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Datil and National Radio Astronomy Observatory. This includes Highway 60 between Mile Markers 64 and 91. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains; West Central Mountains
